creditline: The Ruth Ann Dayton Chinese Room Endowment Fund
description: curved piece of ivory; twenty-four incised holes; nine carved dragons twine around holes, with clouds
text: While extremely rare, hammock stays similar in form to these can be found in album paintings of the 18th and 19th centuries. The use of precious ivory for such clearly utilitarian objects is unusual, but the well-carved dragon-and-cloud decor suggests an upper class owner, probably a literatus.
title: Hammock end
